reviews.sentence: Good. Competent attentive and friendly staff. Good breakfast that was well prepared and maintained. The snow maintenance in Handicapped areas outside could have been better. Too icy and no salt. The ice machine was not properly maintained and needed a thorough cleaning.
Great experience. Checked in with 7 rooms and 29 people and it went off without a hitch. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was perfect for our group. staff.

A short walk to King of Prussia Mall. A reasonably priced Hotel service is pretty standard but not bad. Hotel well kept for age and employees are well mannered and helpful. The breakfast is standard American and needs a difference to bring in more clients. The standard breakfast is boring to international visitors.

Very Nice Property. Traveling to visit family and friends we stopped here. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It is a very clean property. However coming from the direction we were coming into town it was a bit difficult to get to the hotel. A few trial runs and everything worked out well. Mike the front desk clerk was terrific. The only problems we had were a dirty microwave TV volume was not great and we prefer ethernet connection but they did have WIFI. All in all great place to stay and quiet considering it is on a busy street.

Very comfy bed and clean rooms. Very nice stay even though they advertise smoking rooms they apparently have only 3 smoking rooms in the whole hotel so we we placed in a non smoking room even though we requested a smoking room. However the girls at the front desk were so helpful. They were able to put us in a room that was on 1st fl and right next to the exit door outside so we could go out to smoke. The hotel room is very cleanAnd the bed was beyond comfy.

Room Review. Excellent place to stay. Hotel is extremely clean and comfortable. Staff is great and ready to help with any issue that comes up during your stay. The rooms are very comfortable and you get a great night sleep. The breakfast is well prepared and offers many different type of breakfast foods.
Checkin was smooth. Hotel is clean and well kept. The room was clean and had everything i need. The front desk help was easy to work with.

Below average hotel with above average staff. The good. The staff were very friendly at all times When I discovered my shower head was broken I let them know and it was fixed by the time I returned from work. The bad. Internet access WiFi is deplorable. With the free connection I could barely stream video at 240p. I paid for the 5 per day premium internet and it only allowed me to stream at 360p The breakfast was not great. Multiple days when I went down to eat they were out of hot food. The yogurt containers all had expiration dates at least a week old. Summary. After a hard day of work in a town with nothing to do besides shop at the mall which I do not like all I want is to lay down and surf the internet. This was not possible and is the main reason I am switching to Holiday Inn Express for the next time I have to be here for work actually the following week. in a HIE now. It is priced similar to a Holiday Inn Express but worse in every way. To me at least.
Awesome friendly staff. From the front desk at check in to all other staff and hotel personel. wonderful helpful smiles all around.

Unbelievably Slow Internet Speed. The internet speed of this hotel is unbelievably slow and we had problems in watching streaming videos for 8day stays. The breakfasts were also worse than other Hampton Inns. They should prepare for enough fruits and oatmeal. But the staffs were very helpful and impressive.

This hotel is OK in a pinch but look elsewhere. Stayed at this hotel one night before meeting. The hotel is easily accessible off West Dekalb Pike near the King of Prussia mall. Walked in the lobby and it was crowded since it was the weekend of the DNC. The temperature was a bit uncomfortable too as it was warm and the crowd did not help. The staff for checking in was friendly and helpful but that is about all I can say was above average. I got a room on the 6th floor and in taking the elevators I learned quick that they were hot and slow. The room itself was fine. You can see that they are a bit worn out around the edges and the toilet was in rough shape but nothing that makes it unlivable. However the room was very warm do you see a theme here for the entire hotel as the temp was 74 degrees when we walked in. The setting was on 68 so it shows how poor the A C is. I turned it down to 65 and by time I got back from dinner and an errand it was only 72The bed was comfortable and large and the pillows were adequate. When I woke up the temp was only at 68 so it is safe to say the AC is just awful. I went down to breakfast and was wholly disappointed. The food they had was just plain bad. They had some sort of omletes that were clearly microwaved and then some sort of crepe type thing that was disgusting. Obviously it is hard to mess up bagels etc. so they should just save their money and keep those things stocked. Overall I would suggest looking elsewhere first. Location near many restaurants and mall. Close to highways. Numerous restaurants a ton of shopping. TemperatureAlso breakfast.

Price good but service is not. If your looking for a place with a spa and pool I do not recommend staying here as they do nt exist as website has as amenities listed. Arrived to room to find vanity light bulbs blown. I called front desk to get the issue resolved as bathroom was pretty dark and we were waiting to shower. After calling front desk twice and an hour later they finally ended up moving our room. Worst experience yet with this chain.

Needs attention both staff and appearance. Hotel was undergoing renovation so parking was a problem. It needs work as it a well worn property. The room reserved was not available so settle for a handicap room. awful fighting with shower and small single double bed. Front desk personnel wow one dressed like a hospital worker in scrubs the other with bright red hair and less than professional appearance. Worst Hampton Inn we have stayed at.

Road noise and ongoing renovations. The location is good for doing things at nearby Valley Forge etc. BUT one side of the hotel faces the multi lane highway and if you are unfortunate enough to get a room on that side forget it you will get no sleep. Its like you are actually IN the road. And renovations were ongoing while we were there resulting in a mess in much of the hotel things not working like the shower etc. etc. Had to use the 100 Satisfaction Guarantee to get our money back for the stay. Too bad because there were some good things like the breakfast and the helpfulness of the staff. that is why I usually like Hampton Inn.

Another Happy Hampton Stay. Facility 35 stars Staff 5 stars. Older Hampton perhaps or Just maybe I notice things being a Facilities person however room was clean and quiet. The big surprise was how really overly welcoming and polite the staff was. I am always pleased at the Hamptons but truly this team was on point.

Another Happy Hampton Stay. Facility 35 stars Staff 5 stars. Older Hampton perhaps or Just maybe I notice things being a Facilities person however room was clean and quiet. The big surprise was how really overly welcoming and polite the staff was. I am always pleased at the Hamptons but truly this team was on point.

Comfortable beds. Sliding door on toilet room. At check in of my mother in law the clerk could not find the oxygen concentrator she needs for sleeping. The service documented that the item was delivered and picked up but the clerk made no effort to contact anyone else about it is location.

Disapointed. The staff here lacked the knowledge and resources to help guest have a great stay. They basically had a I do not care attitude. When I arrived they did not have the type of reservation that I had reserved and guaranteed with my credit card. My daughter ended up sleeping in a chair the first night.

Awful Hotel Worse Service. Spent the weekend here with my daughter for a lacrosse tournament. I am a Hilton Honors member and know the basic standards for different levels of Hilton hotels. This Hampton Inn is sub standard in every way grounds rooms and service. Stay started with a slow ride up the painfully slow elevator which smelled like marijuana. We were then greeted on our floor by an obviously placed surveillance camera. When we got to our room the layout was fine but several things in the room were not up to par including a bathroom door which doubles as the closet door that fell off the track. We then were asked to move rooms as no maintenance was available to fix the problem. Our next room was not up to par with a normal Hampton Inn. Dirty moldy curtains that do not blocked the light etc. I also experienced a rude and dismissive staff that refused to do basic expected service adequately and also refused to get back to me after repeatedly saying they would. We stayed here with a youth sports team that my daughter is on and several parents had similar issues with the staff being unreaponsive. Would never stay here again. It is basically a Motel 6 at best with a cheap renovation and a rude dismissive staff.

The place is clean. The non smoking room did have a slight smoke smell. They serve breakfast with all the basics and the coffee though not gourmet is decent enough. The workers could at least smile and utter pleasantries only the staff at the front counter were courteous.

Daily room detail was terrible. First night we arrived there were no washcloths. second night the bed was sloppily made no trash taken and towels not replenished. Third night had to track down toilet paper and last day room service skipped our room altogether. Very little time to relax in our room because we were trying to track down room supplies and service.
I do not appreciate law enforcement being called on me as African American male. Nothing. The ignorance of the staff baffled me and my party.

Terrible place to stay. The staff was very poorly trained or knowledgeable about your rooms. I was forced to change my room 2 times. The toilet was clogged in the first and last rooms. I finally decided that if I had to have a bowel movement I would go the the bathroom in the lobby rather than switch rooms again. The floors 7th and 4th were dirty. There was construction going on but the carpet in the hallways could have been vacuumed to look much more presentable. The rooms had a musty smell and I was unable to get it out with the air conditioner. When I needed to warm the room the AC Heater thermometer went from 70 degrees to 80 degrees with no way of regulating any temperature in between. This was a very bad experience for me. I came to Philadelphia for my mothers funeral and I cried more about my room accommodations at the Hampton Inn than I did as my mother was laid to rest.

The location is great walking distance to King of Prussia Mall. The decor in the hallways and elevators can be more updated as it is a bit outdated compared to most of the Hampton Inns that my husband and I have stayed in. The rooms are clean and nice with the exception of nicks in the paint on the walls and inside the compartment where our refrigerator was stored was also peeling paint. The bathrooms are clean and stocked. The front desk was friendly but lacking a bit of professionalism with one of their attendants walking around without her shoes behind the desk. That was a first ever. Would I stay here again maybe not as they have a bit of upgrading to do. With the prime location and being a Hilton hotel I am surprised this location has fell short.

Lower end of the Hampton Inn brand. Check in Check in as painful. The hotel was sold out and the desk ran out of keycards so the front desk staff would have to walk everyone to their rooms to let them in. The Hilton Digital Check In Ap was also not working. That was not quick. I was also offered a choice of a snack as a courtesy because of my Hilton Honors status. They had run out of water and they had also run out of most of the snacks when the clerk checked. The employee was really nice but they were clearly ill equipped for a busy night. Room Quality. Room was older and tired and could certain use a refresh. The furnishings were not bad but for some reason the door was in really rough shape and detracted from the ambiance. The room was on the first floor next to the conference room and very close to the lobby. The room was quite noisy as a result. The window was also looking right out on the parking lot that faced a busy commercial area. Anyways I just kept the shades down for privacy.

No towels for you. The overnight staff was horrible. Questioned me like the inquisition about needing extra towels after the Vilanova Championship win and we were covered in beer and Champaign from the victory party. The staff during the day was great.

Not happy with hotel. Booked here for 4 days groups were booked at the same time put us in a room in the middle of it kept us up most of the night partying overnight staff was no help ran out of food not well managed.

DISASTER. RE. HAMPTON HOTEL – KING OF PRUSSIA 42718 –. 43018We have been loyal to the Hilton Family of hotels for many years. This relationship may be endingThis recent stay was the worst Hampton Hotel experience of our life. Upon checking in on Friday 42718 the coffee was luke warm and there were no cups. The room 20 floor had not been cleaned or carpet vacuumed. Debris on floor and carpet. On Saturday the trash was never emptied and the room not cleaned or vacuumed. There were no clean towels bath mat. Breakfast was terrible – no meat or potatoes – no fruit. Just eggs and biscuits with sausage gravy ran out of biscuits at 810 AM. Dinning area trash not emptied. The bathtub was not cleaned. On Sunday the coffee was too weak to drink even the “ robust ” brew. A housekeeping staff member entered our room with her passkey without knocking and startled my wife. The Housekeeping Manager Teri volunteered and cleaned the room herself late Sunday afternoon and agreed to refund one night stay. T Apologies were continuous however service never really improved. Weekend was a complete disaster at this hotel.

Wait till renovating is done. Checking in we were told we needed to check out and back In The next day because they were renovating our room. When the shower soaked the bathroom floor we saw why. The breakfast was constantly out of things an hour into time. The guy at front desk after telling people on phone there were n’t any rooms said was line out the door with no one at the desk. This Hampton was not up to our normal Hampton experiences. In their defense they are renovating but should probably close floors at a time to do so.

Not the best location in KOP. The location access is hard to get to. The property had seen better days very run down look in hallways and elevator. Rooms have a bad odor housekeeping is minimal and misses things. Breakfast is meh. Night staff is unhelpful and acts like you are interrupting their nap.
